author: Josh Barbanel
title: Palatial Manhattan Penthouse Hits Auction Block as the Market Slumps
text:
Young hedge-fund managers and tech-company millionaires paraded in one after the other during an open house last month, marveling at the soaring grand salon, an 80-foot-long room with huge glass windows protruding above the roof of a cast iron building in the heart of Manhattanâ€™s SoHo neighborhood.
They were pondering a chance to purchase an unusually palatial downtown condominium at what could be a steep discount through a bankruptcy court auction scheduled for next week.
